title: Resources
text:
Animation Vincent Mazet: signal processing animations in JavaScript.
Interactive plots, intro to DSP: (digital) signal processing animations.



GaussianWaves: signal processing for communication systems.
Wireless Pi: signal processing for communication systems.
Interstices: some articles on signal processing.
MFCC et filtres Mel: blog on speech processing, MFCCs coefficients and filterbanks for mel-spectral analysis.



Cours traitement du signal (partie 1) - Vincent Mazet (partie 2) (üá´üá∑): french signal processing lessons by Vincent Mazet from T√©l√©com Physique Strasbourg.
Vid√©os YouTube - Barry Van Veen: YouTube channel on signal processing.
Digital Signal Theory: signal processing lessons.



Digital Audio Resampling: website on digital audio resampling.
Overdub: voice cloning and TTS (and other tools).
Arsonor - Sound Design in the box (üá´üá∑): sound artist website (in french) with articles on the use of audio filters, EQ and more.
GIF scales in audio: GIF to show the different scales of an audio signal.
AES tutorial on coding artifacts: tutorial from the Audio Engineering Society (AES) explaining the basis principles of audio coding and typical audio artifacts.
Speech Processing Lesson Aalto: speech processing lesson from Aalto university, with interesting chapters on evaluation methods (objective and subjective).

title: Resources
text:
üëì Animations - visualizations
Animations on convolution: animations to understand the role of each parameter for deep learning 2D convolutions.
Convolution Visualizer: interactive animation of a convolution.
Neural network architecture visualization: website to generate figures or neural network architectures with three styles: fully-connected, LeNet or AlexNet.
Transposed convolution understanding/visualization: to understand and visualize transposed convolutions.
Image filtering demo: demo on image filtering with filters/kernels to detect object edges.
LLM Visualization: website to visualize and understand Large Language Models (LLMs).
Deep Visualization Toolbox: visualization toolbox of feature maps from an image. associated video.
LaTeX architecture visualization: visualization with LaTeX or well-known neural network architectures.
Live and animated MNIST classification: interactive website showing the solving of the MNIST classification problem by a COnvolutional Neural Network (CNN).
Polo Club of Data Science ¬∑ GitHub: GitHub page of a research team dedicated to the creation of interactive website about Deep Learning, including:

CNN Explainer: CNN feature maps visualization.
GAN Lab: Play with Generative Adversarial Networks in Your Browser!: GAN training ‚Äúlab‚Äù.
Diffusion Explainer: Stable Diffusion Explained with Visualization: diffusion process explanation.

Summit: Scaling Deep Learning Interpretability by Visualizing Activation and Attribution Summarizations (fredhohman.com): CNN learned features visualization.
Why Momentum Really Works: animated blog on the principle behind momentum in optimizers.
Losslanscapes: loss landscape visualization.

title: Resources
text:
‚úçÔ∏è Lessons
CS 230 -Deep Learning - Standford: reminders on deep learning, from Stanford‚Äôs Deep Learning Courses.
The Illustrated Machine Learning Website: nicely illustraded website on Machine Learning.
Cours DL New York en fran√ßais (üá´üá∑): New York Univertity Deep Learning Lessons translated in french.
LLM Course: lots of tutorial and diverse pieces of information about LLMs.
Efficient Deep Learning: book on complexity reduction techniques in neural networks and other subjects.
Formation Jean Zay: documentation to optimize the training of Deep Learning models on the supercomputer Jean Zay.

title: Resources
text:
üíª Blogs
How to train GAN: tricks and advices on GAN training.
Backprop of CNN is convolution: Medium article showing how the backpropagation in a convolution layer is itself a convolution.
Group convolution explanation: interesting explanations and animations on group convolutions.
Article on checkerboard artifacts after transposed convolution: article showing the problem or chechkerboard artifacts arising when using transposed convolution if not proper set.
Distill: collection of interactive blog posts.
Receptive field computation: explanations and formulas to compute the receptive field of a CNN. Other links: https://blog.mlreview.com/a-guide-to-receptive-field-arithmetic-for-convolutional-neural-networks-e0f514068807 and https://medium.com/@rekalantar/receptive-fields-in-deep-convolutional-networks-43871d2ef2e9
Blog on loss vizualization: blog on mode connectivity related to loss landscape.
Deep Visualization: blog on feature maps visualization.

title: Resources
text:
üé≤ Miscellaneous
Flops counting tool for PyTorch: python script to compute a theoretical number of operations for PyTorch CNNs.
GitHub DNN Training Alexandre Defossez: GitHub with tips and base code for neural network training, with links for other resources.
Mojo - new programming language for all AI developers: new programing language for IA compining the experience of Python with performance from C.
Snapshot m√©moire CUDA avec PyTorch: visualization tool to show the memomry used by CUDA.

title: Resources
text:

Markdown

Nemo Fournier‚Äôs website: website of a PhD stude, with some advices on LaTeX

Slides
Slides.com: online (not free) editor to create slides with Reveal.js
Quarto: create slides, website, interactive documents and more from Markdown syntax codes

title: Resources

title: Resources

title: Resources
text:

Make a README: advices on README writing.
Keep a changelog: website on good practice about having a changelog file to inform users about important changes in a code.
Tables generator: easy creation of tables for LaTeX and Markdown.

title: Resources
text:
Environnement de travail

üêç Coder en Python
Installation direct de Python : https://www.python.org/downloads/
Installation via Anaconda : https://www.anaconda.com/download/success
Installation via Miniconda : https://docs.anaconda.com/free/miniconda/index.html Version minimale de Anaconda


üíª Environnement de d√©veloppement
VSCode : https://code.visualstudio.com/Download Ajouter l‚Äôextension Python
PyCharm : https://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/download/ Eventuellement, prendre la version PyCharm Community Edition
Spyder : https://www.spyder-ide.org/ Inclut avec Anaconda


üõ†Ô∏è Librairies Python

üë∂ Librairies standards
L‚Äôensemble des librairies standards de Python est consultable ici : https://docs.python.org/3/library/index.html. Celles principalement utilis√©es sont les suivantes :
math : https://docs.python.org/3/library/math.html Fonctions math√©matiques. Voir cmath pour des fonctions pour les nombres complexes.
random : https://docs.python.org/fr/3/library/random.html G√©n√©ration de nombres al√©atoires. Fonctionnalit√© aussi disponible dans d‚Äôautres librairies scientifiques.
os et os.path : https://docs.python.org/fr/3.7/library/os.html Interface avec le syst√®me d‚Äôexploitation. Tr√®s utilis√© pour la gestion des fichiers et des chemins de fichier.
Pathlib : https://docs.python.org/3/library/pathlib.html Librairie pour g√©rer les chemins d‚Äôacc√®s de fichier sans se pr√©occuper des sp√©cificit√©s li√©es au syst√®me d‚Äôexploitation utilis√©.
argparse : https://docs.python.org/3/library/argparse.html Module de cr√©ation d‚Äôinterface en ligne de commande (CLI).
time : https://docs.python.org/3/library/time.html Mesure du temps d‚Äôex√©cution d‚Äôune portion de code.
subprocess : https://docs.python.org/3/library/subprocess.html Ex√©cution de lignes de commande depuis Python.


üî¨ Librairies scientifiques usuelles
NumPy : https://numpy.org/ Librairie fondamentale pour le calcul sur des tableaux multidimensionnels.
Matplotlib : https://matplotlib.org/ Cr√©ation de figures et graphiques en Python.
SciPy : https://scipy.org/ Librairie de calcul math√©matique : optimisation, int√©gration, interpolation, √©quations alg√©briques, etc.
OpenCV : https://opencv.org/ Librairie pour le traitement d‚Äôimage et la vision par ordinateur.


üß† Librairies de Machine Learning (ML) et Deep Learning (DL)
scikit-learn : https://scikit-learn.org/ Librairie de ML pour les taches de classification, r√©gression, clustering, r√©duction de dimensionalit√©, etc.
PyTorch : https://pytorch.org/ Librairie de DL cr√©√©e par Meta, tr√®s utilis√©e en recherche.
TensorFlow : https://www.tensorflow.org/ Librairie de DL cr√©√©e par Google. Souvent utilis√© avec Keras.
Keras : https://keras.io/ Framework Python de DL qui permet une manipulation de haut niveau, initialement pour le backend TensorFlow, mais supporte √©galement PyTorch et JAX depuis Keras 3.
JAX : https://jax.readthedocs.io/ Librairie de DL orient√©e pour le calcul acc√©l√©r√© (JIT, XLA).
PyTorch Lightning : https://lightning.ai/docs/pytorch/stable/ Framework pour PyTorch pour simplifier l‚Äô√©criture de code.


üé≤ Autres librairies utiles
TQDM : https://tqdm.github.io/ Cr√©ation de barres de chargement.
Soundfile : https://python-soundfile.readthedocs.io/ Lecture et √©criture de fichiers audio.
Einops : https://einops.rocks/ Librairie pour faciliter et rendre plus lisible la manipulation des tenseurs, en particulier pour les transpositions.
TorchInfo : https://github.com/tyleryep/torchinfo Librairie permettant d‚Äôafficher l‚Äôarchitecture d‚Äôun mod√®le et la taille des tenseurs √† chaque couche du r√©seau quand on utilise PyTorch.
Broadcasting : https://numpy.org/doc/stable/user/basics.broadcasting.html Utilisation puissante des tenseurs NumPy pour certains calculs (aussi valable pour TensorFlow et PyTorch).

title: Resources
text:
Ressources Deep Learning

üîó Sites internet
Visualisation architecture r√©seaux : https://alexlenail.me/NN-SVG/index.html Site internet permettant de visualiser quelques r√©seaux de neurones (fully-connected et convolution).
Principe convolution images : https://deeplizard.com/resource/pavq7noze2 Animation sur le principe de la convolution d‚Äôune image par un filtre.
Convolution Visualizer : https://ezyang.github.io/convolution-visualizer/ Visualisation des convolutions en fonction de la taille de l‚Äôentr√©e, de la taille du kernel et des autres param√®tres de padding, dilatation et stride.
Arithm√©tique des convolutions : https://github.com/vdumoulin/conv_arithmetic Toutes les formules pour calculer les tailles des tenseurs en entr√©e et sortie des couches de convolution, et visualiser les effets des diff√©rents param√®tres associ√©s.
Machine Learning illustr√© : https://illustrated-machine-learning.github.io/ Site internet avec des illustrations sympathiques sur le ML et DL.
Pense-b√™tes DL : https://stanford.edu/~shervine/l/fr/teaching/cs-230/ Pense-b√™tes provenant du cours de Stanford CS 230. Il y a aussi des choses int√©ressantes pour CS 229.
Convolutions group√©es : https://blog.yani.ai/filter-group-tutorial/ Blog expliquant le principe des convolutions group√©es.
Convolutions transpos√©es : https://deeplizard.com/resource/pavq7noze4 Blog expliquant le principe des convolutions transpos√©es.
Visualisation champ r√©cepteur convolutions : https://distill.pub/2019/computing-receptive-fields/ Site internet pour visualiser le champ r√©cepteur √©quivalent de plusieurs couches de convolutions.
LLM Visualization : https://bbycroft.net/llm Site internet pour visualiser l‚Äôarchitecture des LLMs (Large Language Models).
Cours LLMs : https://github.com/mlabonne/llm-course Large collection d‚Äôinformations sur les LLMs.
Distill : https://distill.pub/ Blog d‚Äôarticles interactifs en lien avec l‚ÄôIA.


üé• Vid√©os
Fidle CNRS : https://fidle.cnrs.fr/ Cours d‚ÄôIA donn√© tous les ans par le CNRS.
Cours de Stanford : https://www.youtube.com/@stanfordonline Beaucoup de cours d‚ÄôIA de Stanford.
Cha√Æne YouTube The AI Epiphany : https://www.youtube.com/@TheAIEpiphany Vid√©os sur l‚ÄôIA s‚Äôappuyant sur les articles de recherche associ√©s.
Machine Learnia : https://www.youtube.com/@MachineLearnia Cours en fran√ßais ML et DL.


üìö Livres
The Little Book of Deep Learning : https://fleuret.org/francois/lbdl.html Petit livre en format t√©l√©phone contenant de nombreuses connaissances de base en Deep Learning.
Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow Livre m√©langeant la th√©orie et la pratique avec une partie sur le ML et l‚Äôautre sur le DL. Les notebooks sont disponibles ici¬†: https://github.com/ageron/handson-ml3
Deep Learning : https://www.deeplearningbook.org/ Une r√©f√©rence tr√®s connue, beaucoup plus d‚Äôun point de vue math√©matique (pas vraiment du point de vue pratique).

title: Thomas Muller
text:
Hello! I‚Äôm Thomas, a PhD student working at Orange Innovation and IRISA lab (France). My thesis topic is Audio compression using deep learning: the goal is to use artificial neural network to develop the new generation of audio codecs.
I attended the engineer school called Phelma from Grenoble INP group of engineer schools (Grenoble Alpes University). I specialized in signal and image processing and machine/deep learning.
I love playing music: clarinet for more than 15 years, accordion for 3 years, and more recently piano. I had the chance to participate to 4 episodes of the amazing project Trina Orchestra. I also like to take photos and create communication visuals for my associations, see my portfolio.
Some of my previous associations:
